page.title: 03Farming in the Harden Area
page.content: There are two sorts of farming carried on in this area, beef and dairy. This is because the land is quite hilly and a large area is moorland and rough pasture. Therefore it is more difficult to grow cereal crops on this land. The farm buildings are usually very old as farming has been carried on in this area for many years. The beef cattle are sent to market 3 or 4 times a year. The farmer also gets new stock to fatten up at these times. The dairy farmer milks his cows twice a day, morning and evening. A tanker calls to collect the milk once a day then it is taken to a local dairy for bottling.
